Class ElectronicDevice

java.lang.Object
ElectronicDevice
public class ElectronicDevice
extends java.lang.Object
Represents an electronic device within the library with data members representing the unique Id, its location in the library, the device type ( computer, tablet etc.), and whether the device is currently being used by a library member or not.

Each device belongs to one library and can be used to access 0 or more electronic resources.

Since:
2020-11-28
Version:
1.0
Author:
James Welsh

  • Method Details

    • getLibrary

      public Library getLibrary()
      Fetches the data stored in the library data member.
      Returns:
      the library object.

    • setLibrary

      public void setLibrary​(Library library)
      Sets the library object stored in the library data member.
      Parameters:
      library - The library to set. This cannot be null.

    • getDeviceId

      public java.lang.String getDeviceId()
      Fetches the string representing the deviceId.
      Returns:
      the deviceId data member.

    • setDeviceId

      public void setDeviceId​(java.lang.String deviceId)
      Sets the string representing the device. It checks all the argument is a valid diviceId.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The deviceId to set. This must be 8 characters and cannot be the same as another devices deviceId that is currently belonging to the same library.

    • getDeviceLocation

      public java.lang.String getDeviceLocation()
      Gets the string representing the devices location within the library.
      Returns:
      the deviceLocation string.

    • setDeviceLocation

      public void setDeviceLocation​(java.lang.String newLocation)
      Changes the location of the device, for example if the device gets moved to a new location in the library then it's location can be updated to reflect this.
      Parameters:
      newLocation - A string representing the new location that the device will now reside.

    • getDeviceType

      public java.lang.String getDeviceType()
      Gets the string representing device type.
      Returns:
      the deviceType string.

    • setDeviceType

      public void setDeviceType​(java.lang.String deviceType)
      Sets the deviceType data member to a string passed in.
      Parameters:
      deviceType - The string representation of he device type.

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Checks if a device is currently being used by a library member or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean representing whether a device is available or not. Returns true if the device is available or false otherwise.

    • setIsAvailable

      public void setIsAvailable​(boolean isAvailable)
      Updates the devices availability status.
      Parameters:
      isAvailable - takes a boolean value: true if device is available, false if the device is being used.

    • printDeviceDetails

      public void printDeviceDetails()
      Prints all the devices data members in an easy to read format.
